api:field.name: title
api:field.api:text: Enhancing the Effectiveness of Similarity-Based Virtual Screening Using Nearest-Neighbor Information

api:field.name: abstract
api:field.api:text: We test the hypothesis that fusing the outputs of similarity searches based on a single bioactive reference structure and on its nearest neighbors (of unknown activity) is more effective (in terms of numbers of high-ranked active structures) than a similarity search involving just the reference structure. This turbo similarity searching approach provides a simple way to enhance the effectiveness of simulated virtual screening searches of the MDL Drug Data Report database. © 2005 American Chemical Society.

This turbo similarity searching approach provides a simple way to enhance the effectiveness of simulated virtual screening searches of the MDL Drug Data Report database.

api:address.api:line: Krebs Institute for Biomolecular Research and Department of Information Studies, University of Sheffield, Western Bank, Sheffield S10 2TN, U.K.
